usernameDialog.title: Manage users on:
usernameDialog.usernameInfo: This username will be used to store your settings in the vehicle.
usernameDialog.autoSyncWarning: If you don't set your username, auto-sync with the vehicle won't work.
usernameDialog.canSetLater: The user can be set or changed later in the General menu.
usernameDialog.noUsersYet: It seems like you don't have any users stored on this device yet.
usernameDialog.deleteWarning: Be careful when deleting users from the vehicle - this process cannot be undone
usernameDialog.selectOrEdit: Select a user below, or switch to admin mode to create or edit users
usernameDialog.deleteUserWarning: All settings will be permanently removed from the vehicle.
usernameDialog.cannotDeleteCurrent: You cannot delete the current user.
usernameDialog.deleteUserFailed: Failed deleting user. The list was refreshed. Please try again.
usernameDialog.validationMinLength: Username must be at least 3 characters long.
usernameDialog.validationMaxLength: Username must be at most 16 characters long.
usernameDialog.validationCharacters: Username can only contain letters, numbers, and the following characters: _ - .
usernameDialog.validationNoCockpit: Username cannot contain "cockpit" as it is reserved for internal use.
usernameDialog.validationNoFallback: Username cannot contain "fallback" as it is reserved for internal use.

step1.title: Welcome to Cockpit!
step1.content: Thank you for trying our control station software - we hope you make it your own!
step1.opposite: This guide will assist you in connecting to your vehicle, and walk you through the available menu pages.

step2.title: Main Menu
step2.content: Cockpit's configuration options and tools are accessed through its sidebar.
step2.opposite: Open it by clicking the highlighted tab on the left side of the screen.

step3.title: Connections and Behaviour
step3.opposite: The 'Settings' menu allows configuring Cockpit's connections and behavior.

step4.title: General Configuration
step4.content: The 'General' page allows switching the active user, and the vehicle connection settings.
step4.opposite: Each user can have their own settings, interface profiles, and joystick mappings, which can be stored on and synchronized through the connected vehicle.

step5.title: Vehicle Address
step5.content: Cockpit connects to a vehicle's network using a global address.
step5.opposite: This is usually found automatically, but if necessary you can specify a custom domain to connect to and search for the relevant vehicle components.

step6.title: Interface Configuration
step6.opposite: Here, you'll find options to control the interface style, move the sidebar access point, and switch the display units between imperial and metric, for widgets that support it.

step7.title: Joystick Configuration
step7.content: Connect a controller and move a joystick or press a button to see the current function mapping.
step7.opposite: Fully supported joysticks have a visual configuration interface available, but there's also a mapping table provided for custom or uncommon controllers. Actions can be related to vehicle functions.

step8.title: Video Configuration
step8.content: Video sources (from MAVLink Camera Manager / BlueOS) can be given custom names, and you can configure Cockpit's receiver settings to improve performance.
step8.opposite: There are also preferences for the video recording library, to automatically process recorded chunks into video files, and zip together files when downloading multiple videos or a video with telemetry subtitles.

step9.title: Telemetry Recording
step9.opposite: Subtitle overlays of telemetry data can be recorded with videos. This panel allows choosing which variables to include, where they appear on the screen, how the subtitles are styled, and the update rate.

step10.title: Alerts Configuration
step10.opposite: Voice alerts can announce notifications and issues during operation, without covering the screen. The voice and reported alert severities can be configured here.

step11.title: Dev Settings
step11.content: This section includes settings and Cockpit logs to help with development and advanced troubleshooting.
step11.opposite: We recommend leaving the default values, but if you prefer to you can stop Cockpit from synchronizing its settings with BlueOS vehicles, and/or disable sending the anonymous usage statistics and error messages that help the development team to find performance issues and bugs.

step12.title: Mission Configuration
step12.opposite: This panel allows selecting which vehicle commands require an extra confirmation step before sending, to avoid triggering mission- or safety-critical functions accidentally.

step13.title: Tutorial Completed
step13.opposite: If you want to see it again, this guide can be reopened through 'Settings' > 'General'. For further support, please reach out through the channels listed in the 'About' section of the sidebar.

tutorial.snackbarMessage: This guide can be reopened via the Settings > General menu

video.mediaStreamNotActive: Media stream not yet active. Wait a second and try again.
video.recordingStoppedMonitoring: Recording has stopped. Stopping health monitor for this stream.
video.cannotGetFileSize: Cannot get size of the video output file. Please check if the file exists. This can indicate a problem with the recording.
video.videoFileNotGrowing: The video output file is not growing. This can indicate a problem with the recording.
video.chunksNotGrowing: The number of video chunks is not growing. This can indicate a problem with the recording.
video.chunkNotSaved: Oops, looks like a video chunk could not be saved. Retrying...
video.chunkLossWarning: A part of your video recording could not be saved. This usually happens when the device's storage is full or the performance is low. We recommend stopping the recording and trying again, as the video may be incomplete or corrupted on several parts.
video.sequentialChunksLoss: Warning: Several video chunks could not be saved. The video recording may be impacted.
video.fivePercentChunksLoss: Warning: More than 5% of the video chunks could not be saved. The video recording may be impacted.
video.failedToAddChunk: Failed to add chunk to live processor.
video.failedToInitializeLiveProcessor: Failed to initialize live processor for stream.
video.failedToInitiateRecording: Failed to initiate recording. First chunk was lost. Try again.

messages: Distributing dolphins for sonar translations...
Observing octopuses to optimize dark mode...
Persuading Poseidon to trade us his trident...
Sailing the seas, in sync with the breeze...
Jiggling jellyfish to frost up the UI...
Corralling coral for calibration...
Languishing in life-jackets...
Salvaging shipwrecks...
Searching for Nemo...
Singing with whales...
Tuning harps for carp...
Stargazing with starfish...
Recharging electric eels...
Swaying at the seaweed disco...
Fencing in the swordfish showdown...
Assembling AUVs into a single-file line...
Polishing portholes for crystal-clear viewports...
Convincing crabs to stop double-clicking everything...
Syncing compass with the stars (hold still, Orion)...
Kowtowing to kelp for a greener UI theme...
Warming up thrusters — and the coffee machine...
Updating barnacle firmware — this might tickle...
Deploying rubber ducks for safety certification...
Filling ballast tanks with fresh ideas...
Mapping ocean puns… depth-level humor detected...
Rendering waves pixel by pixel — surf's almost up...
Teaching seagulls the latest hover gestures...
Checking tide tables to schedule snack breaks...
Swapping batteries in the sea turtles (just kidding)...
Dusting off code gremlins  —  please keep arms inside the Cockpit...
Aligning gyros — because spin is only fun on dance floors...

vehicleDiscovery.title: Vehicle Discovery
vehicleDiscovery.notConnected: It looks like you're not connected to a vehicle!
vehicleDiscovery.description: This tool allows you to locate and connect to BlueOS vehicles within your network.
vehicleDiscovery.searching_status: Searching for vehicles in your network...
vehicleDiscovery.noVehicles: No vehicles found in your network.
vehicleDiscovery.canStillSearch: You can still search for vehicles in the general configuration menu.

missionEstimates.title: Mission estimates
missionEstimates.extraPayloadDesc: Mass added to the vehicle besides batteries and hull.
missionEstimates.batteryTypeDesc: Li-ion (≈5 g/Wh), Li-Po (≈6 g/Wh), LiFePO₄ (≈9 g/Wh).
missionEstimates.batteryCapacityDesc: Total capacity from the vehicle batteries. Affects mass and power estimate.
missionEstimates.hasHighDragSensor: Vehicle has a submerged probe (e.g. Ping1D sonar)
missionEstimates.hasHighDragSensorDesc: Submerged probes affect drag and consequently, the power consumption estimates.

map.cannotCenterOnHome: Cannot center map on home (home position undefined).
map.trackingHome: Tracking home position. Click to stop tracking.
map.centerOnHome: Click once to center on home or twice to track it.
map.cannotCenterOnVehicleOffline: Cannot center map on vehicle (vehicle offline).
map.cannotCenterOnVehiclePosition: Cannot center map on vehicle (vehicle position undefined).
map.trackingVehicle: Tracking vehicle position. Click to stop tracking.
map.centerOnVehicle: Click once to center on vehicle or twice to track it.
map.cannotPlacePOI: Cannot place Point of Interest without map coordinates.
map.poiManagerNotAvailable: POI Manager (map widget) is not available.

widgetManager.elementNotFound: Could not find element with the given hash.
widgetManager.widgetNotFound: Widget not found with the given hash.
widgetManager.widgetLoadedSuccessfully: Widget loaded successfully with new hash.
widgetManager.cannotRemoveLastView: Cannot remove last view. Please create another before deleting this one.
widgetManager.cannotSelectInvisibleView: Cannot select a view that is not visible.
widgetManager.noVisibleViews: No visible views other the current one.

dataLake.variableNotEditable: Variable with ID {{id}} is not editable.
dataLake.variableCannotBeDeleted: Variable with ID {{id}} cannot be deleted.

videoLibrary.onlyAvailableInDesktop: This feature is only available in the desktop version of Cockpit.

mapTiles.failedToSetDefaultMapPosition: Failed to set default map position.

missionAction.noSurveyPathToGenerateWaypoints: No survey path to generate waypoints from.

general.title: General configuration
general.userSettingsInfo: User related configuration. Here you can set the user that is currently set for this device as well as create a new user account.
general.pirateModeInfo: Pirate mode allows Cockpit to expose advanced features, like setting the frequency of MAVLink messages. Take care when enabling this mode.
general.connectionInfo: Sets the network address for device communication. E.g: blueos.local

joystick.title: Joystick configuration
joystick.connectJoystick: Connect a joystick and press any key.
joystick.generalSettingsInfo: View and configure your controller button and joystick behaviors, in a diagram and/or table display.

video.title: Video configuration
video.streamsMappingInfo: Here you can map your external video streams to internal names and manage ignored streams. Active streams allow you to easily switch between different video sources in Cockpit.
video.allowedWebRTCIPsInfo: Select the IP addresses to allow connecting to for WebRTC video streaming. For best performance it is recommended to only use the most reliable interfaces - e.g. avoid wireless interfaces if there is a tethered/wired interface available. If no value is specified, all available routes are allowed.
video.enableAutoIpRetrieval: Enable auto-retrieval of allowed IP addresses
video.allowedWebRTCProtocolsInfo: Video stream quality may be enhanced by enforcing a protocol that is well-suited to the available network infrastructure. UDP can be lower latency but may drop frames, while TCP enforces frame ordering at the cost of some increased latency and jitter.
video.rtpJitterBufferInfo: Increasing the buffer duration causes additional video latency, but can help to compensate for network jitter and provide more consistent frame timing in the display. Cockpit's default is zero milliseconds, but you can set a custom value, or leave the field empty to use your browser's default.
video.videoLibraryOptionsInfo1: Configure live video processing to process videos in real-time during recording for instant availability when recording stops. This is only available in the Electron (desktop) version.
video.videoLibraryOptionsInfo2: Choose whether to save backup raw chunks alongside the final video file. This provides safety for video reconstruction if something goes wrong, but uses approximately double the storage space.
video.videoLibraryOptionsInfo3: Select whether video and subtitle files should be bundled together in a ZIP archive, or downloaded individually. Zipping allows a single download of a group of files, but requires waiting for the files to get zipped together. Depending on file sizes, the zipping process may complete within seconds or could take minutes.
video.browserVersionInfo: Video processing is not available in the browser version. Your recordings will be saved as raw chunks that can be downloaded and processed using the standalone version of Cockpit.
video.liveVideoProcessingTooltip: Process videos in real-time during recording for instant availability when recording stops
video.liveVideoProcessingTooltipBrowser: Live video processing is only available in the standalone version
video.saveBackupRawChunksTooltip: Save the raw video chunks alongside the final video file for backup purposes.
video.saveBackupRawChunksEnabled: Enabled: Raw chunks are preserved after recording. Videos use ~2x storage space but provide safety for reconstruction if the final video is corrupted.
video.saveBackupRawChunksDisabled: Disabled: Raw chunks are automatically deleted after successful processing, using minimal storage space.
video.saveBackupRawChunksManual: You can always manually clean up backup chunks later using the "Temporary" tab in the Video Library.
video.saveBackupRawChunksBrowser: For the browser version the chunks are always saved by default.

mission.title: Mission configuration
mission.autoSwitchToFlightMode: Auto switch to flight mode on mission upload
mission.enableConfirmationCategoriesInfo: Add an extra confirmation step for UI elements that can trigger mission critical actions.
mission.mapOptionsInfo: Default map position: Defines the initial center and zoom level for the map. Max. vehicle position update rate: Limits how often the vehicle's position is updated on the map to reduce CPU usage.

alerts.title: Alerts configuration
alerts.voiceAlertsInfo: Enable voice alerts to receive audible notifications about system and vehicle activities. Select specific alert levels to customize which types of notifications you receive.
alerts.showArmedMenuWarning: Show warning when opening menu with armed vehicle

actions.title: Cockpit actions configuration
actions.info1: View, manage, and create different types of actions.
actions.info2: HTTP Request actions can be used to call external APIs, like servers, vehicles, cameras, etc.
actions.info3: MAVLink Message actions allow you to send specific MAVLink messages to vehicles.
actions.info4: JavaScript actions give you full flexibility by allowing you to write custom code.
actions.info5: The link button can be used to link Actions to Data Lake variables, so that changes to the variable value will automatically trigger the linked action.
actions.info6: Actions can also be tested/run manually, using the play button.
actions.name: Name
actions.httpRequestDescription: Create an action to make HTTP requests to external APIs and services
actions.mavlinkMessageDescription: Create an action to send MAVLink messages to vehicles
actions.javascriptDescription: Create a custom action using JavaScript code

about.description1: Cockpit is an intuitive and customizable cross-platform ground control station for remote vehicles of all types.
about.description2: It was created by Blue Robotics and is entirely open-source.
about.description3: It currently supports Ardupilot-based vehicles, but has plans to support any generic vehicle, be it communicating MAVLink or not.

dataLake.info: View, manage, and create data lake variables.
dataLake.name: Name

plotter.selectVariable: Please open the Plotter widget configuration menu to select a variable to be plotted.
plotter.selectVariableHint: Select a variable to be plotted
plotter.decimalPlacesHint: Number of decimal places to be displayed
plotter.maximumSamplesHint: Higher values will show more history but may impact performance

missionChecklist.title: Mission Checklist
missionChecklist.description: Before arming the vehicle, make sure the following items are completed:
missionChecklist.typeAndEnter: Type an item and press Enter

videoPlayer.streamNotAvailable: The selected stream "{streamName}" is not available.
videoPlayer.streamChangeInfo: This can happen if you changed vehicles and the stream name in the new one is different from the former, or if the source is not available at all.
videoPlayer.selectNewStream: Please open this video player configuration and select a new stream from the ones available, or check your source for issues.

editPanel.toMainView: To be placed on the main view area
editPanel.toTopBottomBars: To be placed on the top and bottom bars
